glsa.title: IPsec-Tools: racoon Denial of Service
glsa.synopsis: IPsec-Tools' racoon is affected by a remote Denial of Service vulnerability.

background.p: IPsec-Tools is a port of KAME's implementation of the IPsec utilities. It contains a collection of network monitoring tools, including racoon, ping, and ping6.

description.p: Two Denial of Service vulnerabilities have been reported in racoon:

ul.li: The vendor reported a memory leak in racoon/proposal.c that can be triggered via invalid proposals (CVE-2008-3651).
Krzysztof Piotr Oledzk reported that src/racoon/handler.c does not remove an "orphaned ph1" (phase 1) handle when it has been initiated remotely (CVE-2008-3652).

impact.p: An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to cause a Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
